Convert into Jupyter
you can convert this into jupyter notebook if you want the steps are given bellow:
1. In terminal quarto convert file_name.qmd


quarto specific
You could use the quarto default form the documentation or create you own coustom. It’s not working, I don’t know why it isn’t working in the file. :::{.very red} Just some text ::: :::{.layout-ncol=“2”} how much text you add in this collum this will be in two column. :::





References

Asaniczka, and themoviedb.org. 2025. “Full TMDB Movies Dataset 2024 (1M Movies).” Kaggle. https://doi.org/10.34740/KAGGLE/DSV/13740647.

title: Quarto
text:
install the quarto from browser
Add extension with the vs code






Headings Syntax: # Heading 1 ## Heading 2 ### Heading 3 #### And so on



Nitrogen, Potassium



Bullet list: - Nitrogen - Phosphorus - Potassium




Test soil
Apply fertilizer
Measure growth






Google






This is a {python} print("Python") code.







Soil health is the foundation of crop productivity. #### Equations (LaTeX style) • Inline: \(Y = a + bX\) • Block: \[
Y = a + bX
\]








print("hello")

hello






print("hello")

[1] "hello"

Convert into Jupyter

1. In terminal quarto convert file_name.qmd


quarto specific
You could use the quarto default form the documentation or create you own coustom. It’s not working, I don’t know why it isn’t working in the file. :::{.very red} Just some text ::: :::{.layout-ncol=“2”} how much text you add in this collum this will be in two column. :::





References

title: First page
text: For this to run you have to have the index folder with the _quarto.yml.

title: Quarto
text:
this is just used to make the code more good and readable.





my name is durjoy






This syntex used in the yaml to hide the code and just print the result/ out put.
also you can justs show the cell that you want. in the code cell. like:


print("this code will show in the rendered file with output")

this code will show in the rendered file with output







\(quarto render file_name.qmd -P name:Durjoy\)



\(quarto render file_name.qmd --to pdf\)



\(quarto render file_name.qmd -M toc:false -M "subtitle:Your New Title"\)




$

Incremental list

at a time
with
incremental list


Image
also do image which one comes first if you need then find out. It’s a good practice to look on the documentation. you can do bunch of the stuff that quarto maker is not remember the syntex. So find out what you need and work on this.
